titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, April 15, 1875

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
United States Legation
Republic of Liberia

J Milton Turner
to Department of State
Washington D.C.
Relating to the nomination of a person to be appointed Vice Consul

Legation of the United States
Monrovia 15th April 1875

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of the Department's Despatch marked "seperate" and dated 25th February, inviting my attention to the nomination under the Regulations, of a person to be appointed Vice Consul at my post of duty; I beg to state: that the instruction shall receive my immediate attention so soon as I shall have been able
Honorable
John L Cadawalder
Assistant Secretary of State
able to select a suitable person.

Indeed, I should have long since respected, rather observed the requirement of the Regulations in this direction, but for my inability to make my selection of a person adapted, and at the same time available for the position of Vice Consul

I have the honor to be
Sir,
With high consideration, and esteem
Your obedient servant
J Milton Turner
